data.title: Deborah Presley: The Woman Who Claims to Be Elvis Presleys Daughter

data.text:
Elvis Presley, the King of Rock and Roll, is widely regarded as one of the most influential and iconic figures in music history. He had a legendary career that spanned over two decades, and he left behind a legacy that continues to inspire millions of fans around the world. But did he also leave behind some secret children?

While Elvis Presley was only officially married to Priscilla Presley and had one recognized daughter, Lisa Marie Presley, there have been several people who have come forward over the years to claim that they are his biological offspring. One of them is Deborah Presley, a woman who says she is the result of a brief affair between Elvis and her mother, Barbara.

How Did Deborah Presley Meet Elvis?

According to Live About, Deborah was born in 1956 to college sweethearts, though in one interview she says she always felt like her biological father might be someone else. She claims that her mother Barbara met Elvis in 1955, when he was performing at a local fair in North Carolina. Barbara was 17 years old at the time, and she was instantly smitten by the young singer.

Deborah says that her mother and Elvis had a passionate encounter that night, and that she was conceived as a result. However, Barbara never told Elvis about her pregnancy, and she married another man shortly after. Deborah grew up believing that her stepfather was her real father, until she discovered the truth when she was 27 years old.

How Did Deborah Presley Find Out About Her True Paternity?

Deborah says that she found out about her true paternity in 1983, when her mother finally confessed to her on her deathbed. She says that her mother told her that she had kept the secret for so long because she wanted to protect her from the media attention and the possible rejection from Elvis and his family.

Deborah says that she was shocked and confused by the revelation, but she also felt a connection to Elvis and his music. She says that she had always been a fan of his songs, and that she even looked like him. She decided to pursue legal action to establish herself as a legal heir to Elvis Presleyâs estate.

How Did Deborah Presley Try to Prove Her Claim?

In 1989, Deborah filed a lawsuit against Priscilla and Lisa Marie Presley, seeking a DNA test and a share of the inheritance. She also claimed that she had received threatening phone calls from people who wanted to silence her. She said that she was not motivated by money, but by a desire to know the truth and to be recognized as Elvisâ daughter.

However, her lawsuit was dismissed by a judge, who ruled that there was no evidence to support her claim. The judge also said that Deborah had waited too long to file the suit, and that she had failed to show any harm or injury caused by the defendants. Deborah appealed the decision, but it was upheld by a higher court.

What Happened to Deborah Presley After the Lawsuit?

Deborah did not give up on her quest to prove her claim. She continued to seek DNA tests from various sources, including Elvisâ relatives and his alleged love children. She also appeared on several TV shows and magazines, telling her story and showing photos of herself and Elvis.

In 1990, Deborah married Christian Brando, the son of legendary actor Marlon Brando. They had a tumultuous relationship that ended in divorce in 2005. Christian Brando died in 2008 from pneumonia.

Deborah has also faced some legal troubles of her own. In 1992, she was arrested for trespassing at Graceland, Elvisâ former home in Memphis. In 2004, she was charged with fraud for allegedly using fake credit cards and checks. She pleaded guilty and received probation.

Deborah currently lives in Los Angeles, where she works as an artist and a writer. She maintains a Facebook page where she posts photos of herself and Elvis, as well as messages to her fans and supporters. She says that she still hopes to find out the truth about her paternity someday.

Is Deborah Presley Really Elvis Presleyâs Daughter?

The question of whether Deborah Presley is really Elvis Presleyâs daughter remains unresolved. There has been no conclusive DNA test or official recognition from the Presley family or estate. Some people believe that Deborah is telling the truth, while others think that she is lying or delusional.

The only way to settle the matter once and for all would be to have a reliable DNA test done between Deborah and Lisa Marie Presley, or between Deborah and any other proven relatives of Elvis. However, this seems unlikely to happen anytime soon, as both parties have shown no interest or willingness to cooperate.

Until then, Deborah Presley will continue to live with her claim and her controversy, hoping for some closure and some acceptance. She says that she is not looking for fame or fortune, but for a sense of identity and belonging. She says that she is proud to be Elvis Presleyâs daughter, whether anyone believes her or not.
